exceptions.exn: Expects a disjunctive pattern with 1 branch or a conjunctive pattern made of 0 patterns.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
R: list card
y: string
x: string
y0: string
x0: string

Goal:
#_R x = #_R y -> x = y

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
hash_R_app : forall x y : list nat, #_R (x ++ y) = #_R x ++ #_R y
P_inv : forall c : list nat * list nat, c el P -> c = d \/ c = e \/ (exists x y : string, x / y el x0 / y0 :: R /\ c = #_L x / #_R y /\ x / y <> [] / [])
hash_L_diff : forall x y : string, #_L x <> # :: #_R y
hash_swap : forall x : string, #_L x ++ [#] = # :: #_R x
P = [d; e] ++ map (fun '(x / y) => #_L x / #_R y) (filter (fun '(x / y) => is_cons x || is_cons y) (x0 / y0 :: R)) : list (list nat * list nat)
itau1_app : forall A B : list nat, itau1 ?P (A ++ B) = itau1 ?P A ++ itau1 ?P B where ?X : [R : list card x0 : string y0 : string x : string y : string |- Type] ?P : [R : list card x0 : string y0 : string x : string y : string |- stack ?X]
itau2_app : forall A B : list nat, itau2 ?P (A ++ B) = itau2 ?P A ++ itau2 ?P B where ?X : [R : list card x0 : string y0 : string x : string y : string |- Type] ?P : [R : list card x0 : string y0 : string x : string y : string |- stack ?X]
d = ($ :: #_L x0) / ($ :: # :: #_R y0) : list nat * list nat
Zbool.Zeq_bool_eq : forall x y : BinNums.Z, Zbool.Zeq_bool x y = true -> x = y
InitialRing.Neqb_ok : forall x y : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.eqb x y = true -> x = y
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
in_map_iff : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (y : B), y el map f l < -> (exists x : A, f x = y /\ x el l)
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
Setoid.Seq_trans : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y z : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y z -> Aeq x z
Setoid.Seq_sym : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y x
Record almost_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_art { ARadd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; ARadd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); ARadd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); ARmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; ARmul_0_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO; ARmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); ARmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z...
sym = fix sym (R : stack nat) : list nat := match R with | [] => [] | x / y :: R0 => x ++ y ++ sym R0 end : stack nat -> list nat
Zbool.Zeq_bool = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match BinInt.Z.compare x y with | Eq => true | _ => false end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> bool Arguments Zbool.Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
QArith_base.Qdiv = fun x y : QArith_base.Q => QArith_base.Qmult x (QArith_base.Qinv y) : QArith_base.Q -> QArith_base.Q -> QArith_base.Q Arguments QArith_base.Qdiv (_ _)%Q_scope
BinIntDef.Z.pow = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH | BinNums.Zpos p => BinIntDef.Z.pow_pos x p | BinNums.Zneg _ => BinNums.Z0 end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.pow (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => y | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
Ring_theory.IDmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> forall reqb : R -> R -> bool, (forall x y : R, reqb x y = true -> req x y) -> Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp reqb (Ring_theory.IDphi (R:=R))
hash_L_app : forall x y : list nat, #_L (x ++ y) = #_L x ++ #_L y
Record ring_morph (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R) : Prop := mkmorph { morph0 : req (phi cO) rO; morph1 : req (phi cI) rI; morph_add : forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y)); morph_sub : forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y)); morph_mul : forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y)); morph_opp : forall x : C, req (...
tau1_inv : forall (a : nat) (B : stack nat) (z : list nat), tau1 B = a :: z -> exists x y : list nat, (a :: x) / y el B

```coq
intros H.
destruct H as [H | [H | H]].
- inversion H.
- inversion H.
- destruct H as [x [y [H [H [H H]]]]].
  rewrite hash_L_app in H.
  rewrite hash_R_app in H.
  apply f_equal with (f := @length _) in H.
  rewrite!app_length in H.
  injection H.
  intros H'.
  apply Zbool.Zeq_bool_eq in H'.
  rewrite H' in *.
  clear H'.
  apply Setoid.Seq_trans with (#_L x ++ #_R y).
  apply hash_L_diff.
  apply hash_swap.
Qed.```

original: intros H. destruct H as [H | [H | H]]. - inversion H. - inversion H. - destruct H as [x [y [H [H [H H]]]]]. rewrite hash_L_app in H. rewrite hash_R_app in H. apply f_equal with (f := @length _) in H. rewrite!app_length in H. injection H. intros H'. apply Zbool.Zeq_bool_eq in H'. rewrite H' in *. clear H'. apply Setoid.Seq_trans with (#_L x ++ #_R y). apply hash_L_diff. apply hash_swap.
